comments.author: dholbert@mozilla.com
comments.creator: dholbert@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
 1. Visit http://james-ross.co.uk/mozilla/misc/nserror
 2. Type anything into the "Error code" textbox and hit Enter key.
    e.g. type  "search @ moz error lookup".
    (ignore any "invalid value" alerts from the page)
 3. Visit http://olduse.net/
 4. Click in the area titled "Group Selection"
 5. Press downarrow key.

ACTUAL RESULTS: An autocomplete dropdown panel appears **in the upper-left corner of my screen**.

EXPECTED RESULTS: Ideally, no autocomplete dropdown.  I realize that the dropdown could be there due to a bug in the web page, though.  But at the very least, the dropdown should be somewhere on top of the Firefox window...

(Not sure about component -- filing in Widget: GTK for now)

comments.author: dholbert@mozilla.com

comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110605 Firefox/7.0a1
Ubuntu 11.04
comments.raw_text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110605 Firefox/7.0a1
Ubuntu 11.04

Looks like olduse.net uses "ShellInABox" for its usenet shell.

I can reproduce this bug using the basic ShellInABox Demo in place of olduse.net.  That demo is hosted here:
http://code.google.com/p/shellinabox/

(You still need to pre-populate your autocomplete entries at http://james-ross.co.uk/mozilla/misc/nserror , though.  I have no idea why that site's entries in particular are the ones that pop up -- maybe because of some common feature on the <input> element that's being used under the hood?)
comments.author: dholbert@mozilla.com

comments.creator: dholbert@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text:
jX says he can reproduce this on Firefox 5 beta on Win7, so this isn't a GTK-specific bug after all.  Shifting to general "Widget" component for now.

I can reproduce this in Firefox 3.5 and 3.6 builds, too (haven't tried older than that):
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.2.18pre) Gecko/20110505 Namoroka/3.6.18pre
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686 (x86_64); en-US; rv:1.9.1.13) Gecko/20100914 Firefox/3.5.13
